intro: Cynoglossum scorpioides, commonly known as greater mouse-ear hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and northern Africa. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves and clusters of small, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, ditches, and along roadsides. It blooms from late summer to early autumn and has a short lifespan, completing its life cycle within a single growing season. The plant is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
